decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates must be commenced not later than three years from the date of this permission.
To comply with the requirements of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004).
The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out otherwise than in complete accordance with the approved plans (as set out on page one of this decision notice).
For the avoidance of doubt and to ensure that the development is carried out as approved.

No relevant works shall take place in relation to the development hereby approved until samples of all the external finishing materials, as detailed under Section 8 of the application form, are submitted in large-scale drawings showing the details of the windows, doors and sills to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and thereafter the development shall be constructed with the approved materials.

Insufficient information has been supplied with the application to judge the appropriateness of the external finishing materials to be used.  Submission of samples prior to commencement will safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area and will ensure that the development accords with the Local Plan Policies 7 and 28.

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015, no window or other opening (other than those shown on the submitted and approved plan,) shall be formed in the flank wall(s) of the building(s) hereby permitted, unless specific permission under the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 has first been sought and obtained in writing from the Local Planning Authority.

In order to ensure a satisfactory development that will not result in any loss of privacy or damage to the environment of neighbouring properties which exist or may be proposed in the future, and in order that the development accords with the Local Plan Policies 7.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2018: In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, improvements required to make the proposal acceptable were negotiated with the agent (Gary Cumberland) via email on 09/11/21, and 11/11/21. The revisions involved omission of the outbuilding from the scheme; set -in from the width of the existing projection; remove the overhung roof and reduction in depth from from 4m to 3.1m. The amendments were subsequently submitted on 16/11/2021.
